outputFile.comment: The base path to save the generated image. A numeric suffix will automatically be created before the .png file extension.
colorTextFG.comment: The color of the text expressed as a Hexadecimal color specifier
colorNodeOffline.comment: The color of the text for an offline node expressed as a Hexadecimal color specifier
colorNodeDead.comment: The color of the text for a node that has been offline for 1008 blocks expressed as a Hexadecimal color specifier
colorBackground.comment: The color of the background for the image expressed as a Hexadecimal color specifier
colorRowBG1.comment: The primary color to use as the background for data rows expressed as a Hexadecimal color specifier
colorRowBG2.comment: The alternate color to use as the background for data rows expressed as a Hexadecimal color specifier
colorRowFG1.comment: The color of the text for data rows on primary color background expressed as a Hexadecimal color specifier
colorRowFG2.comment: The color of the text for data rows on alternate color background expressed as a Hexadecimal color specifier
width.comment: The width, in pixels to generate the image.
height.comment: The height, in pixels to generate the image.
sleepInterval.comment: The amount of time, in seconds, the script should wait before data gathering and image creation again
pageSize.comment: The number of channels to represent per page rendered
headerText.comment: The text to use in the header area
nodes.comment: Node definitions for which fees, earnings and usage will be reported

nodes._config_summary.comment: A brief description of this item for nodeyez-config app
nodes.enabled.comment: Indicates whether this node definition is enabled for reporting. If set to false, it will be skipped
nodes.address.comment: The address or hostname for this node. It must be reachable from the server running the script
nodes.port.comment: The port for which the node is listening for REST based calls. This is the restlisten value in that nodes lnd.conf
nodes.useTor.comment: Indicates whether calls to the node should be made over tor. For internal IP addresses this should be set to false
nodes.macaroon.comment:
The macaroon for the node in hex format.
Requires permissions for
   uri:/lnrpc.Lightning/GetInfo
   uri:/lnrpc.Lightning/GetNodeInfo
   uri:/lnrpc.Lightning/ListChannels
   uri:/lnrpc.Lightning/ChannelBalance
   uri:/lnrpc.Lightning/ForwardingHistory
   uri:/lnrpc.Lightning/ListPayments.
You may use the nodeyez.macaroon created for that node.
To get the hex value, you may use the command: xxd -ps -u -c 1000 nodeyez.macaroon
nodes.outputFile.comment: The base path to save the generated image. A numeric suffix will automatically be created before the .png file extension for pagination.
nodes.colorTextFG.comment: Override color of the text expressed as a Hexadecimal color specifier
nodes.colorNodeOffline.comment: Override color of the text for an offline node expressed as a Hexadecimal color specifier
nodes.colorNodeDead.comment: Override color of the text for a node that has been offline for 1008 blocks expressed as a Hexadecimal color specifier
nodes.colorBackground.comment: Override color of the background for the image expressed as a Hexadecimal color specifier
nodes.colorBarOutline.comment: Override color of the outline for the channel balance bar expressed as a Hexadecimal color specifier
nodes.colorBarFilled.comment: Override color of the filled portion representing the local balance of the channel expressed as a Hexadecimal color specifier
nodes.colorBarEmpty.comment: Override color of the unfilled portion or background of the channel balance bar expressed as a Hexadecimal color specifier
nodes.displayBalances.comment: Indicates whether local and remote channel balance amounts should be rendered along with proportional bar
nodes.width.comment: Override the width, in pixels to generate the image.
nodes.height.comment: Override the height, in pixels to generate the image.
nodes.sleepInterval.comment: Override the amount of time, in seconds, the script should wait before data gathering and image creation again
nodes.pageSize.comment: Override the number of channels to represent per page rendered
nodes.headerText.comment: Override the text to use in the header area
